                });

                    $('.advanced-tips').slideUp(100);

I know &hellip;  this code is very very dirty.  I&#39;m new to <span class="result-highlight">Java</span> so any other suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import &hellip;

        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/16665124/java-how-to-append-text-to-top-of-file-txt" title="Java. How to append text to top of file.txt">
             Q: Java. How to append text to top of file.txt 
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                I need to add <span class="result-highlight">text</span> to beggining of <span class="result-highlight">text</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> via <span class="result-highlight">Java</span>.

For example I have test.txt <span class="result-highlight">file</span> with data:

Peter
John
Alice


I need to add(to top of <span class="result-highlight">file</span>):

Jennifer 


It should be:

Jennifer
Peter
John &hellip; 
Alice


I have part of code, but It <span class="result-highlight">append</span> data to end of <span class="result-highlight">file</span>, I need to make It that added <span class="result-highlight">text</span> to top of <span class="result-highlight">file</span>:

    public static void irasymas(String irasymai){
        try {
         <span class="result-highlight">File</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> &hellip; 
            </div>

                 that <span class="result-highlight">text</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> as well and reformating them did nothing either.

//saves user information to &quot;Users.txt&quot; which will be called in the finally block after choice switch
public void writeUsers()
{
    try &hellip; I&#39;ve tried using BufferWriter format as well as FileWriter and PrintWriter each with a boolean true statement but they both behave the same as if I simply used a simple new <span class="result-highlight">File</span>. Each time I get &hellip;

            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-io t-append">
<a href="/questions/tagged/java" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'java'" rel="tag">java</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/file" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'file'" rel="tag">file</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/text" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'text'" rel="tag">text</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/io" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'io'" rel="tag">io</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/append" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'append'" rel="tag">append</a>             </div>
            <div class="started fr">
asked <span title="2013-02-09 21:51:14Z" class="relativetime">feb 9</span> by <a href="/users/2057707/personis">personis</a>            </div>

    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-14792030">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>2</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/14791996/output-flles-keep-getting-ovewritten-in-java/14792030#14792030" title="Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java">
             A: Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                The constructor PrintWriter(<span class="result-highlight">File</span>) truncates the output <span class="result-highlight">file</span> by default. The fact that PrintWriter&#39;s method <span class="result-highlight">append</span>() is called doesn&#39;t mean that it changes the mode of the <span class="result-highlight">file</span> being opened &hellip; . The behavior for  <span class="result-highlight">append</span> is described as:


  An invocation of this method of the form out.append(csq) behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation


 out.write(csq.toString()) 


Here, you could use &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-io t-append">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-02-09 21:54:37Z" class="relativetime">feb 9</span> by <a href="/users/871026/reimeus">Reimeus</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-16665190">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes answered">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>1</strong></span>

        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/16665124/java-how-to-append-text-to-top-of-file-txt/16665190#16665190" title="Java. How to append text to top of file.txt">
             A: Java. How to append text to top of file.txt
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                (new <span class="result-highlight">File</span>(&quot;yourFile.txt&quot;), &quot;rw&quot;);
f.seek(0); // to the beginning
f.write(&quot;Jennifer&quot;.getBytes());
f.close();

 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-append t-java-io">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-05-21 08:16:00Z" class="relativetime">may 21</span> by <a href="/users/991778/sanbhat">sanbhat</a>            </div>

    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-14792029">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>1</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">vote</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/14791996/output-flles-keep-getting-ovewritten-in-java/14792029#14792029" title="Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java">
             A: Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                You have to create the PrintWriter in <span class="result-highlight">append</span> mode. Otherwise, when it first opens the <span class="result-highlight">file</span>, it will clear it out. You can open it in <span class="result-highlight">append</span> mode using:

new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(userFile,true)) // the `true` argument opens it in <span class="result-highlight">append</span> mode

 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-io t-append">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-02-09 21:54:36Z" class="relativetime">feb 9</span> by <a href="/users/121993/jeff-storey">Jeff Storey</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-16665482">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>0</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/16665124/java-how-to-append-text-to-top-of-file-txt/16665482#16665482" title="Java. How to append text to top of file.txt">
             A: Java. How to append text to top of file.txt
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                <span class="result-highlight">File</span> mFile = new <span class="result-highlight">File</span>(&quot;src/lt/test.txt&quot;);
FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(mFile);
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(fis);
String result = &quot;&quot;;
String line = &quot;&quot;;
while( (line &hellip;  = br.readLine()) != null){
 result = result + line; 
}

result = &quot;Jennifer&quot; + result;

mFile.delete();
FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(mFile);
fos.write(result.getBytes());
fos.flush();


The idea is read it all, add the string in the front. Delete old <span class="result-highlight">file</span>. Create the new <span class="result-highlight">file</span> with eited String.
 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-append t-java-io">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-05-21 08:34:51Z" class="relativetime">may 21</span> by <a href="/users/1462074/jeff-lee">Jeff Lee</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-17868470">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>0</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/14791996/output-flles-keep-getting-ovewritten-in-java/17868470#17868470" title="Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java">
             A: Output flles keep getting ovewritten in Java
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                 this BufferedWriter <span class="result-highlight">append</span> to the <span class="result-highlight">file</span>, not truncate
            StandardOpenOption.CREATE);
    PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter(bufWriter, true);)
{ 

    output.println(&quot;<span class="result-highlight">Text</span> to be <span class="result-highlight">appended</span>.&quot;);

}catch &hellip;  BufferedWriter. PrintWriter&#39;s println() method, can then be called to write to the <span class="result-highlight">file</span>.

The StandardOpenOption parameters used in this code: opens the <span class="result-highlight">file</span> for writing, only <span class="result-highlight">appends</span> to the <span class="result-highlight">file</span> &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-text t-io t-append">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-07-25 20:48:17Z" class="relativetime">jul 25</span> by <a href="/users/2602585/icasdri">icasdri</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="question-summary-14816181">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>-1</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
                    <div class="status answered">
                        <strong>1</strong>answer
                    </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/14816181/is-it-possible-to-append-columns-to-a-text-file-in-java" title="Is it possible to append columns to a text file in java?">
             Q: Is it possible to append columns to a text file in java? 
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                Am aware that

FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file_name, true);


allows <span class="result-highlight">appending</span> rows to a <span class="result-highlight">file</span>. Is there a way to <span class="result-highlight">append</span> columns of data to a non-empty <span class="result-highlight">text</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> starting from &hellip;  in Unix. If there isn&#39;t a way to do this directly in the <span class="result-highlight">java</span> programming language, would appreciate if someone could share code-bits on calling awk using <span class="result-highlight">java</span> syscalls.

Thanks!
 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-text t-awk t-append">
<a href="/questions/tagged/java" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'java'" rel="tag">java</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/text" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'text'" rel="tag">text</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/awk" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'awk'" rel="tag">awk</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/append" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'append'" rel="tag">append</a>             </div>
            <div class="started fr">
asked <span title="2013-02-11 16:16:32Z" class="relativetime">feb 11</span> by <a href="/users/282544/leba-lev">leba-lev</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="question-summary-7173361">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>0</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
                    <div class="status answered">
                        <strong>3</strong>answers
                    </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/7173361/append-a-character-at-each-beginning-and-end-of-line-in-a-file-using-java" title="Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java">
             Q: Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java 
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                can you help me with this problem.

I want to put some characters/<span class="result-highlight">text</span> at every beginning and end of each line in my <span class="result-highlight">text</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> e.g.

Hi there
Welcome


to 

sometext Hi there sometext
sometext Welcome sometext


Thanks
 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-text t-append">
<a href="/questions/tagged/java" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'java'" rel="tag">java</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/text" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'text'" rel="tag">text</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/append" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'append'" rel="tag">append</a>             </div>
            <div class="started fr">
asked <span title="2011-08-24 09:43:59Z" class="relativetime">aug 24 '11</span> by <a href="/users/909312/user909312">user909312</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-14816246">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>1</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">vote</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/14816181/is-it-possible-to-append-columns-to-a-text-file-in-java/14816246#14816246" title="Is it possible to append columns to a text file in java?">
             A: Is it possible to append columns to a text file in java?
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                No you can&#39;t. There is no such option. You can always open a <span class="result-highlight">file</span> to read, write or <span class="result-highlight">append</span> content to it.

To achieve this, you will need to 


Read each line of a <span class="result-highlight">file</span>
<span class="result-highlight">Append</span> the content to each line.
Write to a temporary <span class="result-highlight">file</span>

 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-text t-awk t-append">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2013-02-11 16:19:59Z" class="relativetime">feb 11</span> by <a href="/users/1135954/mtk">mtk</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-7173591">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>2</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/7173361/append-a-character-at-each-beginning-and-end-of-line-in-a-file-using-java/7173591#7173591" title="Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java">
             A: Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();

org.apache.commons.io.LineIterator it = org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.lineIterator(<span class="result-highlight">file</span>);
try {
  while (it.hasNext()) {
    String line = it.nextLine &hellip; ();
    result.append(&quot;sometext &quot;).<span class="result-highlight">append</span>(line).<span class="result-highlight">append</span>(&quot; sometext\n&quot;)
  }
} finally {
  it.close();
}

org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.writeStringToFile(outFile, result.toString());

 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-text t-append">
            </div>
            <div class="started fr">
answered <span title="2011-08-24 10:02:01Z" class="relativetime">aug 24 '11</span> by <a href="/users/32090/boris-pavlovic">Boris Pavlović</a>            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="question-summary search-result" id="answer-id-7173434">
        <div class="statscontainer">
            <div class="statsarrow"></div>
            <div class="stats">
                <div class="vote">
                    <div class="votes ">
                        <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>2</strong></span>
                        <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/7173361/append-a-character-at-each-beginning-and-end-of-line-in-a-file-using-java/7173434#7173434" title="Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java">
             A: Append a character at each beginning and end of line in a file using Java
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                 FileWriter(new <span class="result-highlight">File</span>(&quot;newfile.txt&quot;), true));

        String strLine;

        while ((strLine = br.readLine()) != null)   {
            bw.write(&quot;someText&quot; + strLine + &quot;someText&quot;);
            bw.newLine();

        }

        bw.close();
        in.close();

 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-text t-append">
            </div>

        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/12885731/appending-characters-onto-string" title="Appending characters onto string">
             Q: Appending characters onto string 
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                I am trying to write code to import all characters (including spaces) of a given <span class="result-highlight">text</span> <span class="result-highlight">file</span> into a single string for analysis. I am using the given <span class="result-highlight">files</span> in <span class="result-highlight">Java</span> for this, and ran across a strange &hellip;  //cannot place inputs/outputs of string on this line
{

StringBuilder <span class="result-highlight">text</span> = new StringBuilder();
//StringBuilder google
//google end of <span class="result-highlight">file</span> check <span class="result-highlight">java</span>

InputStream in = new FileInputStream(&quot;charfile.txt &hellip; 
            </div>

        <div class="summary">
            <div class="result-link">
                <span>
        <a href="/questions/10083060/append-text-at-starting-of-file" title="Append text at starting of file">
             Q: Append text at starting of file  [duplicate]
        </a>
</span>
            </div>
            <div class="excerpt">
                
  Possible Duplicate:
  Prepend lines to <span class="result-highlight">file</span> in <span class="result-highlight">Java</span>  




I have a CSV-<span class="result-highlight">file</span> which supports UTF-8 encoding.
I want to insert some <span class="result-highlight">text</span> in this <span class="result-highlight">file</span> at starting point using <span class="result-highlight">java</span>. How can I do &hellip;  this?
I don&#39;t want to create another <span class="result-highlight">file</span> and write that <span class="result-highlight">text</span> and then contents of this <span class="result-highlight">file</span> into new <span class="result-highlight">file</span>.
 &hellip; 
            </div>
            <div class="tags user-tags t-java t-file t-csv t-utf-8">

            <div class="started fr">
asked <span title="2012-04-10 04:21:27Z" class="relativetime">apr 10 '12</span> by <a href="/users/1164899/ronak">Ronak</a>            </div>

                        <li><a href="http://gaming.stackexchange.com" title="passionate videogamers on all platforms">Arqade (gaming)</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://bicycles.stackexchange.com" title="people who build and repair bicycles, people who train cycling, or commute on bicycles">Bicycles</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://rpg.stackexchange.com" title="gamemasters and players of tabletop, paper-and-pencil role-playing games">Role-playing Games</a></li>
                    
                        <li>
                            <a href="http://stackexchange.com/sites#culturerecreation" class="more">
                                more (21)
                            </a>
                        </li>
                </ol>
            </td>
            <td>
                <ol>
                        <li><a href="http://math.stackexchange.com" title="people studying math at any level and professionals in related fields">Mathematics</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://stats.stackexchange.com" title="statisticians, data analysts, data miners and data visualization experts">Cross Validated (stats)</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://cstheory.stackexchange.com" title="theoretical computer scientists and researchers in related fields">Theoretical Computer Science</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://physics.stackexchange.com" title="active researchers, academics and students of physics">Physics</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://mathoverflow.net" title="professional mathematicians">MathOverflow</a></li>
                    
                        <li>
                            <a href="http://stackexchange.com/sites#science" class="more">
                                more (7)
                            </a>
                        </li>
                </ol>
            </td>
            <td>
                <ol>
                        <li><a href="http://stackapps.com" title="apps, scripts, and development with the Stack Exchange API">Stack Apps</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://meta.stackoverflow.com" title="meta-discussion of the Stack Exchange family of Q&amp;A websites">Meta Stack Overflow</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://area51.stackexchange.com" title="proposing new sites in the Stack Exchange network">Area 51</a></li>
                        <li><a href="http://careers.stackoverflow.com">Stack Overflow Careers</a></li>
                    
                </ol>
            </td>
    </tr>
</table>
                </div>
            </div>

    var ados = ados || {};
    ados.run = ados.run || [];
    ados.run.push(function () { ; ados_load(); });         
</script>

    var _qevents = _qevents || [];
    (function () {
        var ssl='https:'==document.location.protocol,
            s=document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0],
            ga=document.createElement('script');
        ga.type='text/javascript';
        ga.async=true;
        ga.src=(ssl?'https://ssl':'http://www')+'.google-analytics.com/ga.js';
        s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga,s);
        var sc=document.createElement('script');
        sc.type='text/javascript';
        sc.async=true;
        sc.src=(ssl?'https://secure':'http://edge')+'.quantserve.com/quant.js';
        s.parentNode.insertBefore(sc,s);
    })();
